intro: Kyhosia, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. Kyhosia species are typically shrubs or small trees with opposite, simple leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The flowers are often pink or purple and are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. These plants are drought-tolerant and thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
